data: HEM Apheresis - Therapeutic Cytoreduction qdaily for 2 Day (Day of Treatment)
Ensure that consent has been obtained prior to procedure
Record before and after procedure and PRN
Monitor vital signs q15min for 1 hour post line insertion
Monitor vital signs q30min for 1 hour post line insertion
Record before and after procedure and PRN
Insert 2 x peripheral IV if central line not already in place
Monitor for hematoma/bleeding post line insertion
calcium carbonate (calcium carbonate chewable (dosed as elemental calcium)
200 mg, (elemental calcium 200 mg = calcium carbonate 500 mg) PO, q1h, PRN, Other (see comment), drug form: tab-chew
400 mg, (elemental calcium 400 mg = calcium carbonate 1,000 mg) PO, q1h, PRN, Other (see comment), drug form: tab-chew
calcium gluconate titratable infusion (16 mg/mL) in NS
titrate, IV, 1.2 g/h (75 mL/h) minimum rate, 2 g/h (125 mL/h) maximum rate, titrate instructions: as needed for citrate reactions
calcium gluconate titratable infusion (8 mg/mL) in NS
titrate, IV, minimum rate: 0.6 g/h (75 mL/h), maximum rate: 1.2 g/h (150 mL/h) titrate instrutions: as needed for citrate reactions
N/A mL/min/L TBV - Apheresis, IV, Ratio: 1:8 to 1:14
Select the following for granulocyte reduction
30 mL, circuit, Add to 500 mL VOLUVEN bag at 1:12-1:15 in place of ACD-A Solution
